definition: to decide/to determine/to execute (sb)/(of a dam etc) to breach or burst/definitely/certainly

sentences.english: Jane resolutely kept her place at the table;
sentences.chinese: 吉英毅然決然地坐在桌位上不動。

sentences.english: Rub a medical table, resolutely away, but also what?
sentences.chinese: 揉了體檢表，毅然決然地離去，又能怎樣？

sentences.english: He told me this with a straight face but watched my eyes closely as he spoke.
sentences.chinese: 說話時表情毅然決然，但在和我眼神接觸時閉着雙眼。

sentences.english: He courageously and decisively confronted their challenge to his authority.
sentences.chinese: 他勇敢而毅然決然地處置了他們對他的權威的挑戰。

sentences.english: He resolutely went back to the front.
sentences.chinese: 他毅然決然地重返前線。

definition: honor does not allow one to glance back (idiom); duty-bound not to turn back/no surrender/to pursue justice with no second thoughts
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
to leave one's homeplace (to find work, flee disaster etc)
happy and excited (idiom)/in high spirits/in great delight
to travel around many countries (idiom); peregrinations/refers to the travels of Confucius
to rebel against orthodoxy/to depart from established practices
to dash on bravely with no thought of personal safety (idiom); undaunted by dangers/regardless of perils
to vanish without trace (idiom)/to lie low
to have lingering fears/trepidation remaining after a trauma (idiom)
